page.title: 04THE AMBERLEY CHALK PITS
page.content: THE AMBERLEY CHALK PITS INDUSTRIAL MUSEUM. The Museum was established in 1979. From earlier times the chalk had been burned in kilns to make lime for building materials, fertilizers etc.. This no longer happens. The old kilns are on view. Buildings, machines and tools from past ages of industry are preserved. There is a transport section which includes steam-rollers, motor trolleys and a double-decker bus (1920s);open at the top. A road Exhibition traces road construction, development in history. There is the Littlehampton Toll House (1909). displays include omnibuses, domestic appliances,wireless and communications and 'The History of Concrete'. An industrial railway has been made. There are still living in Amberley men who worked at the Chalk pits.
